attributes.action: Carers’ salaries should start on minimum of £12 per hour.
attributes.additional_details: As a carer myself, I heard many stories how carers are struggling to make ends meet. Yet, their dedication to their jobs and their hard work has been particularly seen in current pandemic. Caring is thought to be low skill job, yet unrecognised, these dedicated people make others feel comfortable, happy and safe. By ensuring  their salaries start on minimums £12 per hour would cut the need for carers to work in number of jobs and  would also cut the unnecessary risks of spreading the virus.
attributes.background: I would like the Government rethink how carers in UK are paid. Simply paying minimum wage is not enough for their hard work.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for setting wages for privately employed care workers, but we have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Increase minimum wage for social care staff to £10.72: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/316909

Include Social Care within the National Health Service: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319117
